text: I have a special treat today well every
treat is a special treat but today I'm
making a carrot cake tea cake with cream
cheese frosting and if you ask me
anything with cream-cheese frosting is
extra especially delicious
so I'm grading my carrots depending on
the size of your carrots you'll need two
or one if it's a really big carrot like
this because you need 1 cup of grated
carrot I feel like I'm close let's
measure oh look at that ah nice huh for
the dry ingredients I have one and a
quarter cups of all-purpose flour to
that add a half a teaspoon of baking
soda a teaspoon of baking powder 1/2
teaspoon of salt or a teaspoon of coarse
salt 1/2 a teaspoon of ground cinnamon
smells so good and a half a teaspoon of
freshly grated nutmeg wispier
ingredients well you want to make sure
that you really whisk well because I've
found with mixtures like this that have
carrot in them if you don't incorporate
your baking soda properly the carrots
turn out green it's happened to me
before
that can be set aside for a second while
you get your butter and everything
creaming in my mixer I have one stick of
unsalted butter room temperature and a
half a cup of brown sugar packed dark
brown sugar but you can use light if you
want to scrape down the sides of the
bowl you want to make sure that
everything is fully combined when you're
creaming with brown sugar it's never
going to get as fluffy as it would with
white sugar so don't be looking for that
but make sure that it is much lighter
then you can add your egg two eggs one
at a time
second egg and then a teaspoon of pure
vanilla extract give it one more scrape
before you add your carrots just to make
sure it's really fully combined it looks
a little bit broken right now but it'll
all come back together when you add your
dry ingredients so don't worry about
that beat the carrots in and then just
beat your dry ingredients in I really
want to pour this flour in but I know
that if I do it's going to half of it'll
go down the side of the mixer so I'm
refraining start on low have your oven
preheating to 350 degrees you're going
to want to butter and flour a 9 by 5
inch loaf pan so that when it comes out
it doesn't stick scrape the batter into
the prepared pan or dollop it in any way
smooth the top so that it's even in the
pan
this needs to bake until a toothpick
inserted in the center comes out clean
about 40 to 45 minutes when your cake is
done let it sit in the pan on a wire
rack for about 5 minutes and then take
it out and let it cool completely on a
wire rack when it's cool you can make
the frosting I have one package or 8
ounces of cream cheese in my mixer and
to that I'm adding 1 cup slowly turn on
your mixer
and beat and then add half a teaspoon of
pure vanilla extract feed it until it's
light and fluffy
once all the confectioner sugar is in
you can turn it up to get it a little
bit fluffier that's it now to frost take
your cake on top I feel like maybe I
have a little more than I need I'm sure
some people would beg to differ but I
don't like to completely overwhelm my
cake with frosting if you want to make
it pretty you can use a small offset
spatula like I am just spread the
frosting over the top of your cooled
cake for the huge frosting lovers you
can serve more on the side and they can
spread it on each little bite I've seen
people do that carrot cake tea cake
ready for a slice absolutely gorgeous
fragrant with spices and rich with brown
sugar this cake is sure to please just
about everybody
you
